body.name: TP-Link USB WiFi-Adapter for Desktop PC, AC1300Mbps USB 3.0 WiFi Dual Band Network Adapter with 2.4GHz/5GHz High Gain Antenna(Archer T3U Plus), MU-MIMO, Windows 11/10/8.1/8/7/XP, Mac OS 10.9-10.15

features: USB Computer Network WiFi adapter for PC w/ Lightning-Fast Speed: AC1300 dual-band WiFi to ensure your device runs at full speed (867 Mbps on the 5 GHz band or 400 Mbps on the 2.4 GHz band)
MU-MIMO Technology: Improves the throughput and efficiency of the whole network with MU-MIMO technology.
Dual-Band Wireless: The 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz bands provide flexible connectivity, giving your devices access to the latest dual-band WiFi router for faster speed and extended range.
5 dBi High-Gain Antennas: Advanced external high-gain antennas greatly enhance the reception and transmission signal strength of the USB adapter.
Supports the Latest Operating Systems: This WiFi adapter for PC is fully compatible with Windows 11/10/8.1/8/7/XP and macOS 10.9-10.15
body.description: 1. AC1300 Dual Band WiFi Adapter: The Archer T3U Plus receives WiFi signals on two separate bands for all your online needs. Choose the 2.4 GHz band for up to 400 Mbps of surfing, emailingand social media, or switch to 5 GHz for up to 867 Mbps of gaming, HD streaming and large file downloads.2. Boosted Throughput with MU-MIMO: MU-MIMO technology can provide two simultaneous data streams, improving the throughput and efficiency of the entire network when working with a compatible MU-MIMO router.3. High Gain Antenna for Broader CoverageA high gain antenna reaches your router from farther with more precise directional range, sustaining faster and more stable wireless connections.4. Adjustable Multi-Directional Antenna: Rotate and adjust the antenna in the multi-direction to improve using experience in different environments.Wireless Standards:IEEE 802.11b/g/n 2.4 GHz, IEEE 802.11a/n/ac 5 GHz.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Speeds to Meet Your Needs Archer T3U Plus features a 5 GHz band with speeds up to 867 Mbps ideal for 4K/HD streaming and lag-free online gaming. [1] Browse Effortlessly The Archer T3U Plus’ 2.4 GHz band with speeds up to 400 Mbps is perfect for web surfing, downloading files, and more. [1]
Wider and More Stable Range The advanced serial high-gain antenna structure creates a better overall connection throughout your home.

Boosted Efficiency with MU-MIMO MU-MIMO technology provides two simultaneous data streams, improving the throughput and efficiency of the entire network when working with a compatible MU-MIMO router. [3] Adjustable, Multi-Directional Antenna Rotate and adjust the multi-directional antenna to improve your user experience and performance in different environments.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good USB wireless dongle
reviews.reviewText: I keep a bunch of these around for laptops and even desktops if needed. They provide enough speed for most anything other that 4K streaming. They configure easily and are easy to use. They also work with older 2.0 USB spec hubs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars How I got 802.11ac and 5G working in Windows 11
reviews.reviewText: I've increased from 3 stars to 4 as a result of the following workaround. Can't give 5 stars because the workaround was necessary, and because it took many hours to find!The following apparently solves the problem of being stuck with 2.4G (Wifi 4). Despite all my previous efforts, the device would eventually revert to 802.11n which is limited to 2.4G and Wifi 4. Then I found this:1) Control Panel -> Network and Sharing Center.Identify the TP-Link adapter device. Right mouse -> Properties. Then Configure. Driver tab. Uninstall Device (and attempt to remove driver). Then IMMEDIATELY unplug the USB device.2) Control panel -> Programs and features - TP-Link Archer driver (etc) - if it exists, uninstall it.3) Plug in the Linksys Archer T3U into Windows 11 computer USB 3.0 portThen Right-click on This PC -> Manage; then select Device Manager.Under Network Adapters find TP-Link wireless USB AdapterRight mouse click on the device, then select PropertiesGo to the Advanced tabClick on "Wireless Mode". In the drop-down box, select IEEE 802.11acClick on "OK"If the above solution does not remain successful, I will come back and edit again.ORIGINAL REVIEWThis TP-Link AC-1300 Archer TCU Plus adapter works like it is supposed to.... but only IF you use the latest driver from the TP-Link web site. Based on my experience, the driver that is included on the DVD only gives you Wifi 4 (802.11n) compatibility. Similarly, when I plugged it in without first installing any driver, Windows only supplied a 802.11n driver.The driver I downloaded from the TP-Link web site gives Wifi 5 (802.11ac) compatibility. In Windows 11, once I installed this adapter and connected to a network, I checked what kind of connection I got via the Wifi icon on the bottom right of the task bar. I clicked on that icon, and then on the ">" symbol next to the Wifi connection. Then click on the blue "i" in the blue circle next to the connection. Under "Protocol" iit shows what kind of connection you have: Wifi 4 (802.11n) or Wifi5 (802.11ac).Be sure to install the new downloaded driver BEFORE you plug in the new adapter. Otherwise the 802.11n driver will be automaticaly installed by Windows, and you'll need to uninstall it before you can get the new driver to install properly. If you've already installed the driver from the disk that came with the adapter, you'll need to go into the Control Panel -> Programs and Features to uninstall it before installing the downloaded driver. If instead you attempt to install the downloaded driver without removing the one from the disk yourself, the downloaded installer will attempt to remove it, but will fail. It will appear to have worked, but you'll still get only 802.11n.Once I figured all that out and navigated it successfully, the adapter works wonderfully - significantly better than the adapter inside my PC. I've deducted two stars for the installation challenges. There are multiple ways to get it installed incorrectly. I suspect a lot of people are just using it as an 802.11n device without realizing it. I hope this review helps some people get the full benefits of this device. When properly installed, it is a significant improvement on the adapter inside my PC.ORIGINAL EDIT: I've had to turn off Windows driver updates and also uninstall Dell Support Assist because both services replace the driver for this adapter with an incorrect driver (which lacks 802.11ac support.) If you're not willing to do that, you might want to consider a different adapter.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Didn't work with my desktop but might not be a problem with the device
reviews.reviewText: I needed WiFi capabilities for my desktop PC so I purchased this adapter. The adaptor was not recognized by Windows 10. However, the PC also had issues with another PCI-E NIC card I added. I suspect it's a problem with different versions of NIC drivers. I contacted TP-Link and they eventually responded. However, by that time I already returned the card. Hence, I give it 5 stars for getting support for a product that I think under normal circumstances would work just fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars GREAT HIGHLY RECOMMEND
reviews.reviewText: I bought this because I built my own pc and it didn’t have wifi drivers built into it. This was an easy option to buy and add on and let me tell you, it’s great. I was all worried for nothing. All you do is plug it in and boom, you now have wifi capability to your pc and it pulls up all available networks. I highly recommend this so far!

La instalé en una PC y la verdad funciona de maravilla. No se desconecta en ningún momento, es muy fácil de instalar y la velocidad es bastante buena. Sinceramente no tengo queja alguna y todo va de maravilla hasta el día de hoy.El paquete llegó en buen estado y a tiempo.

reviews.reviewTitle: Consistent performance and signal range are impressive
reviews.reviewText: My experience with this antenna has been generally positive. The ease of installation pleasantly surprised me, even for someone who is not a tech expert. When it comes to quality, the antenna offers solid construction and stable connectivity. Transmission speeds are fast, providing a smooth online experience, whether streaming, online gaming or working from home.Among the highlights, the consistent performance and signal range are impressive. However, the design could be more compact to avoid any clutter on the neighboring USB port. A small compromise for peak performance. For optimal use, be sure to position the adapter out of the way to avoid interference. Regular driver updates are recommended to ensure optimal performance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I tried the highly rated Devolo powerline LAN to get internet upstairs to my desktop only to find that I wasn’t even reaching 10% of the speed at the routerEven though the pc is at the opposite end of the house and on the floor above the router this little adapter got me up to 25%Worked straight out of the box I’m very impressed for the price
Used other brands and had software and compatibility problems. Couple of years and not a problem with this one. Recommended.
